page.title: 10Hartfield Church
page.content: Hartfield C.E. church is over 700 years old,but a wooden building is believed to have been here for 200 years before this. The church has a square tower with a spire added in the 15th Century.The spire has wooden tiles.We measured it to be 127'high. Inside the tower are six bells which were cast in 1782. The church has a nave,chancel,organ,vestry,side chapel south aisle and font. There is also a choir and belfry.A large porch is attached to the north door.Above the west door is a large clock which strikes the quarter hours.There is a nice weather vane on top of the spire. The church is surrounded by a grave- yard which is well kept. Three buildings are near by:-The Rectory,which is Queen Anne,the schol which is Victorian, and Lych-Gate Cottage which is largely Tudor.
